text: Isaiah prophesied primarily during the reigns of which kings of Judah?
verseText: The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.

text: In Isaiah 6, what event prompted Isaiah's vision of the Lord in the Temple?
options: The year that King Uzziah died
verseText: In the year that King Uzziah died I saw the Lord sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up; and the train of his robe filled the temple.

text: What creatures flew above the throne in Isaiah's vision, calling 'Holy, holy, holy'?
verseText: Above him stood the seraphim. Each had six wings: with two he covered his face, and with two he covered his feet, and with two he flew. And one called to another and said: “Holy, holy, holy is the LORD of hosts; the whole earth is full of his glory!”

text: What sign did God promise Ahaz in Isaiah 7 concerning a virgin?
options: She would bear a son called Immanuel
verseText: Therefore the Lord himself will give you a sign. Behold, the virgin shall conceive and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.

text: Isaiah 9:6 prophesies a child who will be called 'Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of...'?
verseText: For to us a child is born, to us a son is given; and the government shall be upon his shoulder, and his name shall be called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.

text: According to Isaiah 11, what will come forth from the stump of Jesse?
verseText: There shall come forth a shoot from the stump of Jesse, and a branch from his roots shall bear fruit.

text: Isaiah 40 begins with a call to do what in the wilderness?
options: Prepare the way of the LORD
verseText: A voice cries: “In the wilderness prepare the way of the LORD; make straight in the desert a highway for our God.

text: What does Isaiah 40:31 promise to those who wait for the LORD?
options: They shall renew their strength; mount up with wings like eagles
verseText: but they who wait for the LORD shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings like eagles; they shall run and not be weary; they shall walk and not faint.

text: Isaiah 53 describes a suffering servant. What does it say he bore?
options: The sins of the Gentiles only
verseText: Surely he has borne our griefs and carried our sorrows; yet we esteemed him stricken, smitten by God, and afflicted.

text: What does Isaiah 55:1 invite those who are thirsty to do?
verseText: “Come, everyone who thirsts, come to the waters; and he who has no money, come, buy and eat! Come, buy wine and milk without money and without price.
